page.title: 14Interview of a Farmer.
page.content: Mr Richard Padfield farms 800 acres near Eldersfield,a large farm for this area,abutting on the northern edge of the survey area.Unlike most farms in the district which concentrate on either dairy cattle or cereals,his farm is divided nearly half and half to grain and beef production. There is a high degree of mechanisation,with the farm worked by three full-time men and one part-time in addition to Mr Padfield and some aid from his retired father.The most time off he can manage is two separate weeks in the year.He reckons that 20 years ago 15-20 workers wuld have been employed to farm the same acreage.The search for greater efficiency is likely to reduce labour still further; he is contemplating the use of two-way radio to improve the effective use of his men.He likes to take his workers
